p.s: To read or not to read?
That is the question.
Shakespeare's words are more than four centuries old and still we know and learn about them today.
Therefore, the question arises wetherwhether or not his works are still relevant today or outdated.
Shakespeare is a common part of our school curriculum but we are also confronted with the famous playwright in other contexts like our modern film and theater industry.
Thus we are still in contact with his works nowadays.
But especially for students his literature seems to be a torture.
The old language is really hard to understand and they cannot relate to the old times.
Therefore, Shakespeare's plays seems very outdated and useless to them.
On the other hand Shakespeare is one of the most famous playwrights of all time who has a great value to our literary and history.
His stories are still well-known nowadays and are an important compstun of general knowledge.
The plots of his playsa re the base for many modern musicals and movoies and therefore still find a part in our pop culture.
For instance the musical West Side Story is based on the drama Romeo and Juliet and the movie Ten Things I Hate About You relates to the plot of The Taming of the Shrew.
This proves that it is still relevant to know about Shakespeare.
Still one can argue that it is not important to read the original play since one can read or watch modernized versions that also transport the plot of his plays.
Nevertheless, I believe that it is of great importance to devote yourself to the original play since Shakespeare indirectly teaches the Elizabethan period throughout a work of art.
Thus, once can learn a lot about history by reading his plays.
Still, it is understandable that especially students are despondent by his literature since the language is outdated and hard to understand.
Therefore, it is necessary to take a look at the origin of this issue: Shakespeare was meant to be seen and heard and not to be read.
Sadly, we barely have any original productions of his plays that students visit with school.
As a result, we have to read his plays and often fail to enjoy them because we get lost in the desperate try to understand what he means.
All in all, I do believe that Shakespeare is still of great relevance and important.
